Annales des empereurs du japon, pp. 417-418. ==Events of the Kanpō Era== * 1742 (Kanpō 2): A comet was seen in the sky.Titsingh, p. 418. * 1742 (Kanpō 2, 8th month): Flooding in the provinces of Musashi, Kōzuke, Shimotsuke, and Shinano. In Heian-kyō, the Sanjo Bridge is washed away.Ponsonby-Fane, Richard. (1956). Kyoto: the Old Capital, 794-1869, p. 321; Titsingh, p. 418. * 1743 (Kanpō 3, 11th month): A comet was sighted in the night sky. This comet is likely to have been what is today identified as C/1743 C1 (De-Cheseaux).Zhuang, T. (1988).
